2.2.5. Lab – Creating an APM Policy - LDAP¶

2.2.5.1. Task – Build a LDAP macro¶

Note

This lab makes use of APM macros to make policies easy to view and manage

The LDAP Macro will verify that the requesting user has a valid account and the appropiate group premisssion

  1. Click the Add New Macro button

  2. Give the macro a name and click save

  3. Open the newly created macro by clicking the plus sign by the name:Macro: LDAP_Query

  4. Adding the LDAP Query action by clicking the plus sign

  5. Select Authentication accross the top, select LDAP Query in the man page, and click Add Item

  6. Update the Properties Tab by modifying the Server, SearchDN, SearchFilter, and Fetch Group setting

  SearchDN      = DC=f5lab,DC=local
  SearchFilter  = UserPrincipalName=%{session.custom.ephemeral.upn}

|image35|

  1. Update the Branch Rules by clicking Branch Rules accross the top of the menu

  2. Click the X button beside User Group Membership, this will delete the Branch

  3. Click Add Branch Rule

  4. Add a name to the branch and click the change button

  5. Click Add Expression

  6. Change the setting to:

  7. Click Add Expression

  8. Click Finish, and then click Save

  9. Next add Message a box, to alert when the LDAP query fails, by clicking the plus on the fallback branch between LDAP_Query and OUT terminal

  10. Select General Purpose tab accross the top, and select Message Box in the main section

  11. Click Add Item

  12. Provide a Name for the message box and the Expression below to report the user who failed the LDAP Query

    Name:    LDAP Failure
Message: LDAP Failure for user %{UserPrincipalName}

  13. Click Save

  14. Edit the terminal to report Success and Failure. Click Edit terminal

  15. Change the Name from out to Success, and click Add terminal

  16. Change the name from Terminal 1 to Failure, and click save

  17. Click the terminal beside the LDAP Failure, and change the setting from Success to Failure

  18. Click Save
